[Member Submission] GIGABYTE Z590I Vision D – Choice for Mini-ITX Content Creation System

June 24 2021

Member Submission

Gigabyte Z590I Vision D – Choice for Mini-ITX Content Creation System

Thanks to Pyr for writing this article and share to AORUS!

Design

Possessing a white tone like other Vision series products, the Gigabyte Z590I Vision D has the size of the Mini-ITX series, but the rigidity and components of the motherboard will overshadow some of its brothers in the line. ATX. Specifically, the motherboard has a large and hard aluminum alloy heatsink that covers the VRM, SSD and chipset areas.

Test system

Processor: Intel Core i5-11600K

Motherboard: Gigabyte Z590I Vision EASY

Heatsink: Gigabyte Aorus Liquid Cooler

RAM: Gigabyte DESIGNARE DDR4 3200MHz 64GB (2x32GB)

VGA: Gigabyte GeForce RTX 3080 VISION OC 10G

Case: Antec Striker

Source: Gigabyte P750GM

Temperature

In small systems, the temperature of the system and components is always the top concern. Due to size and space factors, users may not be able to dissipate heat as well as ventilate as well as large systems.

During this test, the CPU was pushed to maximum capacity, and the measured temperature fell to about 70 degrees. With Intel's latest 6-core, 12-thread Core i5-11600K processor, this is a pretty cool temperature. For SSDs, the temperature of this important part also only falls between 54 and 64 degrees Celsius, depending on the task. When in sleep mode, the CPU has a stable temperature of 40 degrees Celsius.

Memory and PCIe

For content producers, PCIe RAM and bandwidth are important factors, as they often have to compress, export, and store huge volumes of video. Intel Core i5-11600K is enough to serve the needs of personal content production, including professional Vloggers and streamers.

As for PCIe, Intel's 11th generation processors themselves have improved quite a bit, thanks to the upgrade to PCIe Gen4. This test section shows that the system has a high PCIe 4.0 bandwidth, about 5445 GFLOPS.

Gigabyte DESIGNARE memory is manufactured in a white color that matches its content creator range. The product does not have RGB lights like other RAM pairs for games, but it is still luxurious and minimalist. Testing on AIDA64 shows that Gigabyte Z590I Vision D can bring low latency, about 50nm for its DESIGNARE RAM pair.

Conclusion

For content producers, PCIe RAM and bandwidth are important factors, as they often have to compress, export, and store huge volumes of video. Intel Core i5-11600K is enough to serve the needs of personal content production, including professional Vloggers and streamers.The Gigabyte Z590I Vision D is a quality addition to the Vision product range for content creators. The motherboard has a wide variety of connection options which is one of the great advantages of the product, combined with a beautiful, neat design. The performance of PCIe makes it easy for users to comfortably equip high-speed VGA and NVMe SSDs, combined with Thunderbolt 4 and USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 ports for all-around storage.
